verb.description: Publicly criticize (someone or something) by using ridicule, irony, or sarcasm.
examples: the senator made himself famous as a pinch-penny watchdog of public spending, lampooning dubious federal projects

noun.description: A speech or text lampooning someone or something.
examples: does this sound like a lampoon of student life?

origin: Mid 17th century: from French lampon, said to be from lampons let us drink (used as a refrain), from lamper gulp down, nasalized form of laper to lap (liquid).
